input.content:
Filter the following raw HTML state into a clean observation via code based on the task. State:
Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "Gravida.".
  • Tab #1
  • Tab #2
  • Tab #3

Arcu pulvinar massa, rhoncus vulputate tristique vestibulum. Consectetur. Imperdiet bibendum sagittis adipiscing in praesent. Neque. Diam tincidunt amet. Etiam urna.

Diam integer pellentesque quam diam. Phasellus enim lacus mauris feugiat scelerisque elementum nisl nascetur. Ac, accumsan, turpis pellentesque id. Enim.

Augue interdum viverra dictum rhoncus,. Enim. Gravida. Malesuada. Magna quam in venenatis posuere mattis id vitae, vitae. Urna, interdum interdum.

If the link is in multiple tabs, you only need to find one of the tabs. Keep the clean observation in a string variable `obs` in this format: 'Click on the link "xxx" in Tab #1/#2/#3'. The string of the raw state is already in the variable `state` so do not repeat the state in the code. Here are some examples: Write code within three backticks '```' to Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "integer.". Code: ```python from bs4 import BeautifulSoup # parse the HTML state soup = BeautifulSoup(state, 'html.parser') # Find all tab content divs tabs = soup.find_all('div', {'class': 'ui-tabs-panel'}) for idx, tab in enumerate(tabs, 1): if tab.find('span', string="integer."): obs = f'Click on the link "integer." in Tab #{idx}' break ``` Write code within three backticks '```' to Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "morbi". Code: ```python from bs4 import BeautifulSoup # parse the HTML state soup = BeautifulSoup(state, 'html.parser') # Find all tab content divs tabs = soup.find_all('div', {'class': 'ui-tabs-panel'}) for idx, tab in enumerate(tabs, 1): if tab.find('span', string="morbi"): obs = f'Click on the link "morbi" in Tab #{idx}' break ``` Now, write code within three backticks '```' to Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "Gravida.". Code:

output:
```python
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
# parse the HTML state
soup = BeautifulSoup(state, 'html.parser')
# Find all tab content divs
tabs = soup.find_all('div', {'class': 'ui-tabs-panel'})
for idx, tab in enumerate(tabs, 1):
    if tab.find('span', string="Gravida."):
        obs = f'Click on the link "Gravida." in Tab #{idx}'
        break
```

input.content:
Observation:
Click on the link "integer." in Tab #2
Action:

```
agent.click_xpath("//*[@href='#tabs-2']")  # Switch to Tab #2
agent.click_xpath("(//*[@id='tabs-2']/p/span[text()='integer.'])[1]")  # Click on the link 'integer.'
```

Observation:

```
agent.click_xpath("(//*[@id='tabs-1']/p/span[text()='morbi'])[1]")  # Click on the link 'morbi'
```
